TopicTitle: (1.0.4 Compatible) SSP: Space Shuttle Program (On Hold for Internal Reorganization)

Articles.Content:
Are you ready to send me some crafts?

- - - Updated - - -

Oh funny story, my dad actually got to see the first launch of the XB-70
aww that's so cool. maan nothing happens here...

Yeah, not much here either... But my dad also was working at a hotel where the space shuttle astronauts were testing Enterprise, and after becoming friends with them, they hired him to tend a party which had them and multiple other test pilots, including Bruce Petersen, the test pilot who lost his eye in a lifting body crash.

..........YES

what is this new toy for JEB?

http://i.imgur.com/ghvWXqW.jpg

I'll see if I can make some nice custom sounds for you.
I think living 10 miles from the cape is the coolest thing ever

Yeah man, you're really lucky.. I've been down there twice before. But my grandfather was an air traffic controller not too far from Edwards. (There was actually an astronaut who lived on their street)

I think living 10 miles from the cape is the coolest thing ever

Well, I bet it does get annoying if they have to shut down roads because of rocket launches, I remember the Army shutting down roads because PT training. Anyway, I hope your ear is alright.

Well, I bet it does get annoying if they have to shut down roads because of rocket launches, I remember the Army shutting down roads because PT training. Anyway, I hope your ear is alright.

I'm leaving to the doctor to get surgery now
Good luck, mate! Hope all goes well

Hey man, I can edit the credits on the video. Please send me a PM with the info you want there and I'll change it.

By the way, I'm glad to see this mod back

You know i couldn't just let it die!

I think living 10 miles from the cape is the coolest thing ever
Yeah it's sweet, I live in Orlando so I know what your talking about

Yeah it's sweet, I live in Orlando so I know what your talking about

Nice. That's a good.. What like 40 miles?

30 miles... I saw the atlas launch perfectly... Could Actually see the stages

Edited September 6, 2015 by MajorLeaugeRocketScience

30 miles... I saw the atlas launch perfectly... Could Actually see the stages

Yea all if Florida saw that launch. This seen in Miami!!

Yea all if Florida saw that launch. This seen in Miami!!

Holy..... i dont even have words.... that looks awesome.... I really want to live in florida now... well more than I already did...
I'd want to live in florida just to see rocket launches.
wow you guys are all lucky. Last time I saw a spaceship at the cape was in December 2010, STS-133
Last time I saw a launch was.... never. Apparently the first time I went to the cape there was a launch, but I was in an Imax theater at the time.

last time i saw a launch was.... Never. Apparently the first time i went to the cape there was a launch, but i was in an imax theater at the time.

doh!!

doh!!

I don't wanna brag but sometimes I do my homework in the atlantis building at KSC

I don't wanna brag but sometimes I do my homework in the atlantis building at KSC

Luckyyyyyyyyyyyyyyyyyyy

Last time I saw a launch was February 2014, it was a Delta IV with a GPS sat. My dad and I went to KSC to visit the VAB and LC-39A, and just by luck there was a launch that night... BTW, Triston, I would take a week long vacation to the Atlantis exhibit if I could... Yeah I only like an hour and a half from Enterprise, but Atlantis is so much cooler... plus I saw Atlantis on her final flight. I'm hoping to pursue a career in Aerospace Engineering, so hopefully I'll get to see a lot more launches in the future.
Yeah, I've seen the enterprise multiple times....

Yeah, I've seen the enterprise multiple times....

Same here. I saw Enterprise while on display at the Smithsonian, and multiple times now that she's on display at Intrepid. I never get tired of visiting Enterprise, but I do think Atlantis is cooler... Three reasons: 1) she's been to space. 2) I saw her final launch. 3) The way she's displayed just looks cooler. And yes, I rever to the shuttle as a 'she'...

Well, the Enterprise is still pretty cool, because it led to the others.

Edited September 6, 2015 by CommanderSpock
